items.title: C# Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) at Risk Placement Services, Inc. () (allows remote)
items.content:
***Please note, no visa sponsorship is available for this position. Only U.S.
residents will be considered.***

RPS is transforming its business model to emphasize online capabilities. We
are looking for a Mid to Senior SDET with a passion for making development
teams more efficient and productive. An individual that has the wisdom and know
how to create an infrastructure to support a truly world-class product
development team. We are in the early phases of this process and the candidate
will help drive the direction and implementation of an automated test framework.

It is important for this candidate to hold the highest level of commitment to
automated testing, product quality, and agile methodologies to help guide the
team as it continues to grow.

RPS technical executives have a high level of commitment to developer
training, tooling and resources to empower contributors to grow and perform at
their highest levels. We provide subscriptions to Pluralsight and Safari books
online. We have a yearly team get together usually around a VSLive or some
other training opportunity.

Skills & Requirements

VS 2015
Selenium
SpecFlow
C#
RESTful APIs
Javascript UI Frameworks
SOLID Object Orientated Development Skills
TFS
Agile / Scrum experience
Kanban
Microservices
Distributed computing experience is preferred
eCommerce experience preferred

In order to apply, please complete the coding test linked below. Once we
receive your submission we will contact you if interested.

About Risk Placement Services, Inc.

Risk Placement Services opened for business in May 1997 with four employees
based in Chicago and Atlanta. Since then RPS has completed dozens of
acquisitions across the United States, acquiring top talent in all aspects of
insurance.

At RPS, our focus is on smart and strategic growth, as well as the needs of
our retail partners.  Today, our more than 1,300+ associates stand ready to be
a strategic business partner in marketing new and renewal business through our
wholesale brokerage operations, MGAs, program managers and standard lines
aggregator. We have the local knowledge, regional presence and national reach
to provide the best options to our clients.

Specialties: Wholesale Broker and Managing General Agent, Casualty, Property,
Analytics, Healthcare, Workers Compensation, Transportation, Executive Lines,
Technology & Cyber, Public Entity, Personal Lines

Joel Test score: 11 out of 12

The Joel Test is
a twelve-question measure of the quality of a software team.

* Do you use source control?
* Can you make a build in one step?
* Do you make daily builds?
* Do you have a bug database?
* Do you fix bugs before writing new code?
* Do you have an up-to-date schedule?
* Do you have a spec?
* Do programmers have quiet working conditions?
* Do you use the best tools money can buy?
* Do you have testers?
* Do new candidates write code during their interview?
* Do you do hallway usability testing? External URL apply now

items.title: Manual QA Tester (remote) at MobyMax (Philadelphia, PA) (allows remote)
items.content:
Fifteen million students are registered and using MobyMax. Our goal is to have
all 55 million students in the U.S. learning twice as fast, and this is where
you come in.  We need you to make sure MobyMax is stable and bug free.

We are looking for a Manual QA Tester with three or more years of industry
experience writing and executing test plans, and performing manual testing.

This is a full-time, remote position. 

To apply, please email your resume, earliest start date, and salary
expectations tohire2@mobymax.com . 

No recruiters, agencies or third-parties.

Skills & Requirements

*
At least three years of hands-on experience in a manual testing position

*
Perform manual testing of our websites and applications

*
An eye for detail and UX sensibility to catch non-technical UX issues

*
Find and report defects with detailed, accurate, and concise steps to reproduce

*
Ability to evaluate a product, design spec, or user story and convert it into
an actionable test plan

*
Must be located in the USA (East Coast time zone preferred)

*
Must be able to communicate in English (written and orally)

About MobyMax

MobyMax creates a unique, individualized education plan for each student,
allowing gifted students to progress as quickly as they like while
simultaneously ensuring that remedial students get the extra instruction they
need.

To see what it is like for a teacher to use MobyMax in a classroom, have a
look here:

http://www.vimeo.com/mobymax/mobysuccess


Joel Test score: 11 out of 12

The Joel Test is
a twelve-question measure of the quality of a software team.

* Do you use source control?
* Can you make a build in one step?
* Do you make daily builds?
* Do you have a bug database?
* Do you fix bugs before writing new code?
* Do you have an up-to-date schedule?
* Do you have a spec?
* Do programmers have quiet working conditions?

* Do you have testers?
* Do new candidates write code during their interview?
* Do you do hallway usability testing? apply now <> more jobs at MobyMax <>
Join us at MobyMax

We have great benefits
Top notch pay No commute needed Amazing coders See your kiddos on lunch breaks
(no commute)

items.title: QA Engineer at MeetingSense Software (San Diego, CA) (allows remote)
items.content:
If you want to work remotely as a full-time engineer for an innovative,
leading company in an emerging market, you've found the right team! As a core
member of our engineering team, you’ll solve complex technical problems in a
fast-paced, collaborative environment with experienced leaders and a clear
roadmap.

Responsibilities:

* Interact directly with stakeholders and/or the product owner to gain an
understanding of the application elements, design and product direction.
* Provide user experience, usability and design feedback to the development
team.
* Review specifications and develop test cases.
* Identify, track, and manage bug lists.
* Design, implement and maintain automated test suites.
Skills & Requirements

* Experience with cloud environments (PaaS and IaaS).
* Experience with JavaScript, CSS and HTML.
* Experience as a QA Engineer (or Software Engineer).
* Extensive experience with all testing methodologies (black box, gray box,
white box, system, functional, exploratory and automated testing).
* Extensive experience writing test cases and defining testing processes.
* Experience working in a Scrum or Agile environment.
* Intimate knowledge of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDL).
* Pixel perfect attention to detail.
* Self-motivated and able to work autonomously.
Bonus:

* Experience working with AngularJS or similar frameworks.
* Experience with C# or any software development experience.
* Experience with A/B and usability testing.
* Any experience working with API-centric architectures.
About MeetingSense Software

The MeetingSense Story

MeetingSense Software Corporation is a venture backed start up that was
founded in 2006 by former IBM and Macromedia management to address the emerging
need among today’s businesses for a simple but effective way to collaboratively
manage meeting information and action items in order to optimize business
productivity.

The goal was to develop software that would allow businesses to maximize their
return on investment in meeting time and meeting technology by ensuring that
each meeting, regardless of size, scope, or subject, is leveraged directly into
productive action.

The result is the company’s flagship product, MeetingSense, a fully integrated
and hosted collaborative software solution for optimizing meeting productivity.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against
applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, veteran status, or on the basis of
disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

items.title: Software Quality Engineer- Online Pizza Ordering at Granbury Solutions (Grapevine, TX) (allows remote)
items.content:
In the great Northwest they call it an SDET.  Other places they call it a
Software Quality Engineer.  Whatever they call it, it's you.  You've somehow
found yourself writing code that tests other people's code.

At Granbury we respect the mighty SQE and we'll need your help making sure
drunk college kids can order pizza on their phones.  And no, that isn't a joke.
 You'll use a new front end test automation tool we've built on top ofSelenium
WebDriver to make sure our online ordering systems work reliably and accurately.

Like Wes Mantooth, the other developers may hate you for it, but
they will respect you.

And they'll work with you.  When you need DOM elements to have id's, they will
give you id's.  You won't have to slog your way through with unwieldy xpath
expressions.  You won't be a second class citizen and you'll get the respect
and support you need.  No code ships without a green bar from you.

And you'll do all this from the comfort of your own home.  This is a remote
position, but you'll keep in touch with your team with daily virtual standups.
 We'll pick a spot on the map every so often and get together for a technical
conference (including PNSQC in October) or an in person design confab. But most
importantly, you'll help level the technology playing field for mom and pop
pizza shops in their struggle against corporate pizza.  If you have a grudge
against the major pizza chains, this is your chance to get even.

Skills & Requirements

Preferred Qualifications

You have a degree in computer science.  You've been working in a Test Engineer
or SDET role for at least five years.  You've worked with Selenium or Selenium
Web Driver for at least 2 years.

You've done all this in the Java ecosystem with JUnit.   Ideally you've built
front end test suites that run on a continuous integration platform like
Bamboo, Jenkins, or Team City.  We use Jenkins.

You understand the occasional tedium of front end test automation, picking
through the DOM and hunting for treasure.  You have the stamina for it.

You've done cross platform testing for consumer facing applications, maybe
even PCI testing.  You understand how to setup test runs on mobile device farms
and browser farms.

And more importantly, you're happy in an SQE role and it's your chosen career.

You must have the right to work in the US legally.  Offshore applicants will
not be considered.

About Granbury Solutions

We're Granbury Solutions.  We make software for malls, wineries, and yes,
pizza shops.  Our Thrive and Firefly POS systems are used by thousands of
independent pizza restaurants all over the world to satisfy the needs of
families, college kids, and drunkards everywhere.

We work from home and we get together every day for a virtual stand up.  We go
to at least one conference a year and we sometimes fly in for design sessions
or project war rooms.  We try to take cool nerdy field trips.  Last time we
went to the Hanford LIGO Observatory and saw how giant lasers can detect
gravity waves.  It was cool.

Joel Test score: 10 out of 12

The Joel Test is
a twelve-question measure of the quality of a software team.

* Do you use source control?
* Can you make a build in one step?
* Do you make daily builds?
* Do you have a bug database?
* Do you fix bugs before writing new code?
* Do you have an up-to-date schedule?
* Do you have a spec?
* Do programmers have quiet working conditions?
* Do you use the best tools money can buy?
* Do you have testers?
* Do new candidates write code during their interview?
* Do you do hallway usability testing? apply now <> more jobs at Granbury
Solutions <>
Join us at Granbury Solutions

We have great benefits
Health Insurance Free Home Internet Complementary Infants Free Technical Books
Regular Technical Conferences

Who you’ll work with
Jeffrey Payne

items.title: Android Automated Test Engineer at Eleos Technologies (Greenville, SC) (allows remote)
items.content:
We take software quality seriously, and we believe fast and reliable automated
tests are an important piece of that goal. We’re looking for a contractor with
experience building out an automated test suite for an Android app to help us
level up our testing by building out a solid foundation for new tests. You
won’t spend the majority of your time writing individual test cases—instead,
we’re looking for someone to define the architecture and direction of our test
suite, then assist in building and verifying the new test apparatus.

Skills & Requirements

* You have several years of Android development experience
* You’ve used Android UI test automation frameworks, such as Espresso,
Robotium, or Robolectric, to build test suites in the past
* You’re excited about making Android apps tap, swipe, and pinch all on their
own
* As a bonus, you have worked with cloud-based device testing services such
as Firebase Test Lab or AWS Device Farm
About Eleos Technologies

We’re an 11-person early-stage company focused on making life better for
long-haul truck drivers. Our products are used by thousands of drivers to
handle (and reduce!) their paperwork, plan itineraries, and to communicate
without being tied to their truck.

Our engineering team is fully remote, so we have some experience successfully
bringing someone new into our digital world. We promise you won’t end up
stranded in a Hangout while everyone else in the office gets donuts. (We’re
bring-your-own-donut, as we find they don’t ship well.)

We believe strongly in choosing the right tool for the job, so you’ll have
flexibility in your technology and library choices. You’ll have the support of
our full-time Android engineer in your efforts, and we’ll start writing test
cases on top of what you build as soon as it’s ready.

Joel Test score: 11 out of 12

The Joel Test is
a twelve-question measure of the quality of a software team.

* Do you use source control?
* Can you make a build in one step?
* Do you make daily builds?
* Do you have a bug database?
* Do you fix bugs before writing new code?
* Do you have an up-to-date schedule?
* Do you have a spec?
* Do programmers have quiet working conditions?
* Do you use the best tools money can buy?
* Do you have testers?
* Do new candidates write code during their interview?
* Do you do hallway usability testing? apply now <> more jobs at Eleos
Technologies <>

items.title: QA Engineer
items.content:
DEVEXI is looking for a QA Engineer to join our team.

DEVEXI is an early stage healthcare analytics startup building a powerful,
sophisticated yet intuitive longitudinal research data platform linking medical
and dental data to enable researchers to connect the dots between diagnoses,
treatments, prescribed drugs, exposures and short and long-term health outcomes
– for groundbreaking, longitudinal studies never before possible.

DEVEXI will enable health and medical researchers, universities, teaching
hospitals, insurance payers, government health agencies and pharmaceutical
companies to improve quality of health care delivery, identify best practices
and increase successful, cost-effective outcomes.

Culture Fit

* Able to act as the team goalie
* Able to work effectively as part of a remote team
* Be friendly
* Be a self-starter
* Able to assist users through a testing process
* Able to prioritize and context switch when necessary to achieve the bigger
vision
Skills Required

* Working knowledge and solid understanding of:
* Ticket workflow on a scrum development team (JIRA)
* Git (Bitbucket)
* RESTful web services & SaaS
* SQL
* JSON
* Responsive web design and cross browser/device testing
* Linux command line basics
* Direct, hands-on prior experience with:
* Reproducing defects that may occur with end users
* diagnose & infer root causes where possible
* write tickets that are useful/actionable for developers
* User Story and Task verification
* Test case creation and execution for a SaaS product
* Data-oriented testing: compare results of queries made in the browser with
data in the database
* Excellent reading, writing and communications skills
* able to explain a defect to the team in plain English
* elicit requirements clarifications from SMEs where needed
* Extra credit for:
* QA automation experience (selenium or alternatives)
* Fluency in Java
* Experience with AWS
* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field
Benefits

* Involvement in big data health analytics to enable groundbreaking
longitudinal research
* Full-time remote work (1099 contract)
* Excellent work/life balance
* No travel required
* Work with quality team of professionals
Must be a U.S. Citizen.

items.title: QA Engineer Mobile Healthcare Apps
items.content:
Our mobile healthcare technology platform is changing the way patients
experience healthcare for conditions like COPD, kidney failure/dialysis,
obesity, knee/hip replacement and many others.  We are looking to hire a
Quality Assurance Engineer to oversee our testing and release operations, and
to ensure our software solutions meet the highest quality standards.  


The ideal candidate is: 



* A team player that is eager to dig in and find software bugs before our
customers do

* Able to clearly communicate issues in verbal and written form for future
reference

* Self motivated and able to analyze and solve problems

* Has IMPECCABLE attention to detail and is organized (some might call you
picky)

* A go-getter who takes initiative

* Someone who stands up for quality in the face of deadlines

items.title: QA Engineer
items.content:
We have a unique opportunity for a part time (2-3 days) QA Engineer to gain crucial commercial experience in an exciting team and company.

Masabi are looking for a QA Engineer to join our JustRide Validation team and to help with manual testing.

You will have the opportunity and gain experience working across a variety of applications and services including mobile apps, back office services, APIs, databases.

Masabi develops software that allows customers to buy and display tickets for public transport (trains, buses, trams etc) on their smartphones. We have our solutions running in the UK, New York, Boston, Athens, Los Angeles and other cities around the world. The platform consists of consumer facing hybrid mobile apps on Android and iOS, native mobile apps, gate and bus units for ticket inspection, a back office web interface for clients to monitor activity and a large suite of back-end APIs powering them all.

items.title: TechCrunch Disrupt Winner seeks Momentous Mobile QA Engineer
items.content:
Seenit is growing! On the back of winning TechCrunch Disrupt Europe, we’re growing our product development team and are looking for an experienced Mobile QA Engineer to join us.

Using Python and Couchbase as a backend, HTML5 with JavaScript for the front-end, all running on Google’s Cloud Platform along with native iOS and Android apps, London’s Hottest Startup, Seenit, are helping brands like the BBC, HSBC, Unilever and The Body Shop tell their stories through collaborative film with our multiple-award winning mobile video platform - we’ve won quite a few of those in the past year, including Startup of the Year at the BIMA awards, and we’re even winning awards for our clients, including Innovation in Mobile at the Melcrum Awards.

We’re now looking for an QA Engineer with strong mobile experience to help us take the app to the next level. You’ll be working with a great team who come with years of experience from companies like Spotify, Google, Picsolve, Pearson, and IBM, and our Founder started her career at Working Title Films.

Ideally, you’ll have:

* Experience with mobile automated testing frameworks, for iOS and Android
* Experience of creating test automation frameworks
* Experience of at least one programming language e.g. Ruby/Java
* Mobile Testing (manual testing / functional testing)
* Experience of working in cross-functional, agile development teams

Bonus points if you have:

* Continuous Integration, Jenkins, Linux and Bash scripting
* Implementing performance testing and load automations
* Ruby

Take a look at our "website":https://seenit.io if you’d like to find out more, and feel free to drop us an email if you’ve got any questions or think you’re the right candidate.

*About Seenit*

Founded in January 2014, Seenit is an award-winning video collaboration platform that enables companies to produce high impact video at scale by engaging their own communities of employees, customers and fans around the world. Everyone today has a camera on their phone and people are turning to video as their default means of communication. Seenit enables companies to capitalise on this shift in behaviour by creating authentic and reactive content with their communities. We’ve worked with over 100 brand across the broadcast, retail and corporate markets including the BBC, BT Sport, Vevo, Clinique, Benefit, Accenture, Rolls Royce and HSBC. In December 2016, Seenit won the coveted "TechCrunch Disrupt Startup Battlefield trophy":https://techcrunch.com/2016/12/06/seenit-wins-startup-battlefield-disrupt-london-2016/

items.title: Web/Mobile Quality Assurance Engineer
items.content:
Here at Mindera, we are continuously developing a fantastic team, and would love it for you to join us.

Do you have the feeling that you keep breaking everything? Working as a Quality Assurance Engineer at Mindera, you will ensure that high standards are kept throughout the development process and within the product deliverables. You will also have an important role in planning and developing automated test suites.

*REQUIREMENTS:*

*You're Good At*
* Agile methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban.
* Leading quality assurance processes and functional testing.
* Working with Software Engineers to ensure the right levels of test automation are built to your standards.
* Programming in C# or a similar object-oriented language.
* Source control systems.

*You Rock At*
* Breaking things and finding problems!
* Designing test scenarios, scripts or procedures that fit with the concepts of Test Automation and Continuous Delivery
* Creating resilient automated test suites to exercise web applications with tools like Selenium, using page objects and behavior driven approach
* Being self-driven and working with little supervision towards a common team or company purpose.

*We Offer*
* Fantastic working environment built on the principles of lean and self-organisation;
* Fun, happy and politics-free work culture;
* Competitive salaries and benefits;
* Potential to international travel;
* Working with high profile clients in consultancy environment;
* No dress code, corporate speak or middle managers.

Expected traveling time (PT and USA): 0%-15%, varies according to project/client.

*About Mindera*

At Mindera we use technology to build products we are proud of, with people we love.
Software Engineering Applications, including Web and Mobile, are at the core of what we do at Mindera.
We partner with our clients, to understand their product and deliver high performance, resilient and scalable software systems that create an impact in their users and businesses across the world.
You get to work with a bunch of great people, where the whole team owns the project together.
Our culture reflects our lean and self-management attitude. We encourage our colleagues to take risks, make decisions, work in a collaborative way and talk to everyone to enhance communication.
We are proud of our work and we love to learn all and everything while navigating through an Agile, Lean and collaborative environment.

Check out our Blog: http://mindera.com/ and our Handbook: http://tinyurl.com/zc599tr

Our offices are located: Porto, Portugal | Leicester, UK | San Diego, USA
UK: Think IT Solutions Ltd is part of the Mindera Group

items.title: QA Engineer
items.content:
Booking Live Software is looking for a QA Engineer to join their growing team. This person will be responsible for the development and execution of exploratory and automated tests to ensure product quality.

*Responsibilities*

* Defining the success criteria for the build and launch of new sites/projects against the captured requirements
* Testing website projects for functionality, accuracy and adherence to web standards and design
* Measuring test coverage and prioritising which areas to test first
* Undertaking manual testing and setup when required
* Responsible for test case/plan designing, developing and their implementation that validates software functionality

*Requirements*

* Experience in reviewing requirements / scope documents
* Experience writing and reviewing test scripts
* Excellent stakeholder management skills
* Cross browser testing experience
* Load testing experience
* Mobile and various form factor testing
* The ability to reproduce issues and correct them

Preferred Knowledge in the following applications

* Selenium IDE
* Behat / Gherkin
* jMeter
* JIRA
* Gitlabs
* PHP / MySQL
* Experience in testing large complex eCommerce systems

items.title: Automation Engineer/QA Manager  at Taro (Qulinary, Inc.), Remote OK, engineering
items.content:
Automation Engineer/QA Manager (remote OK) at Qulinary Inc.
Qulinary Inc.
<>
Automation Engineer/QA Manager (remote OK)

Palo Alto, California, United States Full-time Allows remote

About the Role

Are you passionate about quality and love writing code? We're looking
for someone to take charge of expanding our test automation coverage and own
the overall quality process. The right candidate will have a demonstrated track
record of improving quality through expanding automated testing as well as
experience wrangling the manual "last mile" of testing. This position is part
QA Manager, part automation engineer. 

Must haves

* Minimum 3+ years commerical experience with software QA of iOS, Android,
big browser, and mobile web platforms
* Must be able to code; demonstrated ability to expand automated test coverage
* Fire in the belly with a hunger for building great products; must be
self-driven and motivated
* Able to work independently; able to coordinate and drive testing plan with
distributed team
* Keen eye for quality and a taste for perfection plus an uncanny ability to
break everything you touch!
* Significant overlap of working-hours overlap with IST or PT timezones
* Comfortable writing JavaScript
Nice to haves

* Love of food - if you drink soylent look elsewhere!
* Experience with JavaScript unit testing frameworks such as chai+mocha or
similar
* Experience with JavaScript integration testing frameworks such as cucumber,
protractor, or similar
* Working knowledge of server-client/RESTful architecture
* Knowledge of MEAN stack and/or hybrid native (ionic) apps
Pay commensurate with experience and location.

Like what's on the menu? Apply now and tell us about your favorite food as
your cover letter.

About Taro



Taro is the Y-Combinator of food entrepeneurs. Taro works with local chefs who
pour their heart and soul into their food to create meals with a distinct
character, but have limited opportunities to build and sustain their business.
Many Taro Chefs don't have a restaurant - they are true food entrepreneurs who
sell food directly to foodies. Taro Chefs are passionate about creating
healthy, delicious dishes, and many specialize in “micro-cuisines” that aren’t
found elsewhere. Taro enables these local chefs to create and grow their
business by connecting them to new customers while automating marketing and
operations.

Taro was born in Shivangi’s Aunt’s kitchen in Palo Alto where she found a
great demand for local, authentic food. Taro became a reality because we have
made it our mission to help people find the food that makes them happy. Join us
in the food entrepreneurship revolution!
  Apply for this opening

Apply for this opening at
http://qulinary.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk06es5?apply=true

Other openings at Qulinary Inc. <>
See all the jobs at Qulinary Inc. here: http://qulinary.recruiterbox.com/jobs

items.title: Insight Catastrophe Group | https://www.icg360.com/ | Quality Engineer | REMOTE preferred | full-time
items.content:
Insight Catastrophe Group | https://www.icg360.com/ |
Quality Engineer | REMOTE preferred | full-time
Insight's vision is to innovate and modernize property insurance solutions
through technology, risk management and consulting from industry experts.
Insight uses sophisticated modeling to deliver value to clients and
policyholders nationwide.

We have a mostly-remote software organization, developing a RESTful
web-services platform the supports HTML and Flash (for now) front ends. We are
looking to add an engineer to our QA team, focused primarily on automation of
tests against our HTML interfaces. There's a lot of low-hanging fruit here
right now, we just don't have the resources to pick it yet.

Our ideal candidate has some experience with Selenium and testing, but is
hungry to learn more about the best way to produce and maintain high-quality
software.

If this interests you, send me a note: alecmunroicg360com

items.content:
QA Engineer (Automation) | CareMessage (YC W14) | REMOTE | FullTime CareMessage
is looking for a QA Automation Engineer to help with manual and automated
quality assurance of the CareMessage web application and API. You will be

items.title: Senior QA Engineer at Airtame (København, Denmark) (allows remote)
items.content:
As a Senior QA engineer at Airtame, you are an advocate for quality. You help
push the standard of the product forward, and ensure that customers always
receive excellent deliverables. Your role will be working closely with our
software engineering team to provide both manual and automated testing at all
levels of the product.

Our talented engineers are given significant ownership and responsibility over
projects. We value rapid iteration, continuous integration and testing, and we
are serious about producinghigh-quality, maintainable software
. Frequent code reviews,
linting, and pairing are all integral components of our engineering culture. We
encourage experimenting with new technologies and constantly challenge
ourselves to improve our code, processes, and systems.

Skills & Requirements

Your skills

* Significant experience in IT, with an emphasis on QA and managing defects.
* Ability in writing test cases, running functional, automated, or
performance tests.
* Experience writing automated tests for user interfaces using tools like
Selenium
* Experience with at least one dynamic scripting language. (e.g., Python, JS)
* Experience in Agile environments using BDD and TDD.
* Experience with continuous delivery and integration is a plus. (e.g.,
Jenkins, Travis)
* Experience testing audio visual products is a big plus.
* Experience in testing hardware using differing wifi environments is a big
plus.
* Experience testing React based web applications is a plus.
What's in it for you?

* Be part of a top-notch engineering culture which thrives on learning and
having fun
* Daily catered lunch, fridge full of sodas, snacks, and great coffee
* Slacklining, fussball, hackathons, meetups, parties and many more events
* Perfect office location in the heart of Copenhagen (around the corner from
Rådhuspladsen)
* Competitive salary
* Your choice of hardware
How to apply

Apply for this job by sending an email to tech-jobs@airtame.com
with the subject: Senior QA Engineer. Tell us a
little about yourself and why you’re interested in joining the Airtame team.

About Airtame

At Airtame, we’re passionate about wireless HDMI. It’s not just about the
satisfaction of getting rid of screen cables (even though that’s an awesome
feeling). We want to help people have simpler, more productive work lives.
Airtame was founded back in 2013. Since then, our team has raised $1.3M in a
crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo and has sold more than 30,000 Airtame units
with a total revenue of $3.15M. And that’s just the start.

When you join our team, you become a part of our community of 36 people from
around the world. We’re based in windy Copenhagen and have offices in San
Francisco and Boston. If you’re into transparent management, independent work,
midday coffee runs, and high fives, submit your application ASAP.

Check out our Airtame Culture Trello board to learn more: 
https://trello.com/b/ZXs2YYy6/airtame-culture


Joel Test score: 12 out of 12

The Joel Test is
a twelve-question measure of the quality of a software team.

* Do you use source control?
* Can you make a build in one step?
* Do you make daily builds?
* Do you have a bug database?
* Do you fix bugs before writing new code?
* Do you have an up-to-date schedule?
* Do you have a spec?
* Do programmers have quiet working conditions?
* Do you use the best tools money can buy?
* Do you have testers?
* Do new candidates write code during their interview?
* Do you do hallway usability testing? Email apply now <> more jobs at
Airtame <>
Join us at Airtame

We have great benefits
Daily catered lunch and snacks Flexible working schedule Great location in
downtown Copenhagen Your choice of hardware Free coffee and soda Top-notch
engineering culture Competitive salary Slacklining, fussball, hackathons,
meetups, parties and more events

Who you’ll work with
Attila Sukosd
c python embedded-linux php
view profile <> Andrew Keating
go python web scalability
view profile <> Pierre Fourgeaud
c++ c c# c++11
view profile <> Learn more about Airtame <> more jobs at Airtame

items.title: QA Engineer - Do Good. Do Well. Have Fun Doing It. at LiteracyPro Systems, Inc. (Boulder, CO) (allows remote)
items.content:
LiteracyPro Systems creates software to make the world a better place. We are
leaders in the custom web application space for government agencies. Our data
collection and reporting software helps agencies help millions of disadvantaged
people improve their opportunities to get jobs with sustainable, living wages
for themselves and their families. Enjoy being part of a fun group of bright,
passionate folks, in a great working environment, with superb salary & benefits
while helping those who help others.

We’re looking for an extraordinary QA Engineer to help us grow our new,
cloud-based application.   This enterprise application – known as “CommunityPro
Suite” – was released last Spring and is getting rave reviews. Our Company is
poised for explosive growth in the coming months due to national demand, and
we’re looking for a talented engineer with the smarts, passion and people
skills to test and be part of moving CommunityPro Suites forward. You’d be an
important player as we continue expanding the product according to our roadmap.

CommunityPro Suite enables huge state and local agencies to securely match,
consolidate and share data between themselves in real time. The purpose of the
software is to reduce organizational friction by helping local agencies help
people achieve economic self-sufficiency. The end goal is to play an important
role in creating healthy, vibrant communities.

Please no staffing agencies or contractors.

Skills & Requirements

* Agile experience - 5+ years
* Manual and Automated test design and experience - 3+ years
* Identify, isolate and track bugs through testing - 3+ years
* Create Test Plans - 3+ years
* Analyze Test Results - 3+ years
* Experience generating and using scripts (php, python, bash, etc) - 3+ years
* Ability to participate and contribute to a team.
* Ability to break projects into attainable progress goals, estimate and
deliver on time.
About LiteracyPro Systems, Inc.

Based in Boulder, Colorado, LPS’s culture strongly supports independence, open
communication and individual responsibility. With an extremely small turnover
rate, we adhere to solid business processes and agile development protocol. We
are huge believers in well-defined user stories before any coding begins. Our
development team works closely with our business analysts to generate estimates
based on detailed items for every sprint.

LPS has been serving educators and social service providers for the past 20
years. Anticipating the huge demand for inter-agency case- and
referral-management enterprise-wide software, we began designing and building
this application two years ago. CommunityPro Suite is gaining lots of buzz from
dozens of state and local governments across the country. It’s an exciting time.

Joel Test score: 12 out of 12

The Joel Test is
a twelve-question measure of the quality of a software team.

* Do you use source control?
* Can you make a build in one step?
* Do you make daily builds?
* Do you have a bug database?
* Do you fix bugs before writing new code?
* Do you have an up-to-date schedule?
* Do you have a spec?
* Do programmers have quiet working conditions?
* Do you use the best tools money can buy?
* Do you have testers?
* Do new candidates write code during their interview?
* Do you do hallway usability testing? apply now <> more jobs at LiteracyPro
Systems <>
Join us at LiteracyPro Systems, Inc.

We have great benefits
High competitive salaries Excellent medical/dental benefits with low co-pay
Generous vacation benefits Lots of great restaurants nearby Free organic
coffee, tea, fruit, snacks Light, bright office with lots of windows Near
public transportation Near three local gyms
Learn more about LiteracyPro Systems <> more jobs at LiteracyPro Systems

items.title: Junior Quality Manager (m/f) - Hungary
items.content:
Visual Meta GmbH is an innovative e-commerce company based in the heart of Berlin, which has grown rapidly since being founded in 2009. In 2011 our company was acquired by the Axel Springer Group, Germany’s leading publishing house.
We run shopping platforms named LadenZeile and ShopAlike worldwide, offering fashion, furniture and a variety of other products to our users. Our service is used by thousands of daily visitors and an ever-increasing number of partner shops.
Now we are looking for a motivated colleague (m/f) for our international quality team to support and promote the expansion of our shopping portal www.shopalike.hu as soon as possible.

Your profile:
• At least a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent working experience
• Ideally first experience in the e-commerce sector and knowledge of the Hungarian e-commerce market
• Analytical and logical thinking
• Very motivated mindset and the willingness to learn and take over own responsibilities
• Very structured and organized working manner with a high attention to detail
• A communicative Team player
• Native Hungarian and good English skills
• Good understanding of MS-Office, ideally good HTML and Excel knowledge

Your responsibilities:
• Responsibility for the quality management of our Hungarian platform
• Check our Hungarian content for optimizations and mistakes
• Create, Provide and implement relevant content
• Set up new and modification of current brands, categories and filters
• Work closely with our SEA department regarding page improvements
• Ensure that shop items match user searches and research of relevant product keywords
• Continuous market and competitor monitoring
• Maintaining the Hungarian platform for various devices such as desktops, mobile pages, tablet pages and our mobile apps
• Look proactively for website improvements

What we offer:
• A committed, successful and international team
• Opportunity to work independently and gain lots of insight into the field of e-commerce
• Continuous training possibilities and room for further personal development
• Flexible working hours and a great office in the heart of Berlin
• Healthy snacks (fruits, cereals), water and hot drinks
• Team events, movie nights, table football, ping-pong, company bikes, etc.

If you are interested in an exciting position within a friendly team, please submit your application in English including cover letter, CV, your earliest starting date, salary expectations as well as relevant references.

items.title: Senior QA Automation Engineer
items.content:
You are a self starter who has a passion for finding bugs. By using your
unique perspective as QA Engineer you break the code to forge a better product.
At Modus Create you will collaborate daily on a cross functional, distributed
SCRUM team to build better products. We pride ourselves on not just being
excellent, but an excellent remote workforce.

Your Duties In This Role - You will act as senior QA Automation Engineer on a
team building Sencha ExtJS app for the insurance industry. You will discover
bugs and vulnerabilities and decide how to fix them You will collaborate daily
representing QA on a SCRUM team. This is a full-time contract, remote role.

For this role, You Must Have:

* Previous experience testing Sencha ExtJS apps
* Experience with Sencha Test or Siesta Framework
* Current experience with JavaScript
* Have Linux Shell Scripting knowledge
* Clear written communication skills in order to document concise bug reports
and test cases
* Experience testing in a SCRUM environment
* A good understanding of cross browser testing, typical vulnerabilities
* A consistent, reliable internet connection
Not required, but priority will be given to candidates who:

* Have experience with CI tools such as Jenkins
* Have MySQL experience
* Have prior experience setting up and installing VMs
Discover what is possible with Modus Create:

* GitHub repos for your projects
* A chance to get your personal projects sponsored
* Connect with your colleagues
* Assisted continuous self-development

items.title: QA: Test Analyst (Enterprise, Web, Mobile, BPM) Remote at Primotus Division of CargoTel, Inc. (Baltimore, MD) (allows remote)
items.content:
Primotus is developing a unique user-configurable mobile workflow platform
where practically every aspect is configured by users using drag and drop
“builders”. Technologies in our stack are some of the latest and includes
Scala, BPM, Angular, Ionic, Selenium, Protractor, and Saucelabs.



We’re an international team of (currently) 8 full-time developers and getting
close to launch of base platform. We’re looking for an experienced team-focused
Test Analyst to assure platform is bug free, performant, and user-friendly.
Position is open to US and non-US residents who meet the requirements outlined
below and are in or near the ET timezone. 

You’d be: Spearheading manual testing efforts of a complex mobile and web
platform by developing and executing test plans, uncovering bugs and suggesting
UI/UX modifications, interacting with developers, and updating documentation
with goal of improving platform’s usability, reliability, and responsiveness.
Some of the specifics include:

* Assisting with platform design with eye on UX design/usability
* Creating and implementing test plans and manual tests both for performance
and functional purposes
* Reviewing app error logs and metrics
* Construct instructions for bug duplication
* Documenting test procedures and communicating problems and solutions to team
* Juggling multiple stories and implementations simultaneously
* Improving platform testability and augmenting testing tools
* Enhancing documentation
* Pairing with frontend, backend, and analysts
* Available to work on Eastern Time (ET)
If you think you’re a good fit and are interested in helping to build
something highly configurable and really innovative, please shoot us an email.

Skills & Requirements

You’re expected to have:

* 3+ years professional testing/QA experience, including mobile testing.
* Knowledge of testing tools for both for web and mobile
* History of writing test plans
* Background in test case management and bug tracking
* Exposure to automation tools such as Selenium
* Knowledge of scrum or agile methods
* Strong verbal and written communication skills (English)
* Ability to work in a paired-development environment
* Bachelor's degree from University or College
* Attention to detail and good UX skills
* Self starter having worked remotely
* Committed to meeting testing deadlines.
Nice to have:

* Knowledge of Business Process Management (BPM) or enterprise workflow.  
* Experience with third-party integrations
* Exposure to cloud computing platforms such as AWS
Experience with some of the tools highlighted above along with Agile
development using JIRA and Git

About Primotus Division of CargoTel, Inc.

Primotus is a development-stage company creating a revolutionary way of
delivering cloud-based mobile and web business applications based on BPM. Each
are configurable on-the-fly through the use of drag and drop templates (forms,
documents, etc), visual BPM models, user-configurable mobile application, and
visually-appealing reporting engine. Additionally, a myriad of data capture
technologies are used in conjunction with mobile applications including GPS
(along with mapping), Bluetooth Low Energy, RFID, and sensors.

See our yet-to-be-released web site for more information:
http://loki.primotus.com:8080

Competitive salary and full benefits including medical, dental, vision, 401k,
and flex time for USA residents.
apply now <> more jobs at Primotus Division… <>
Join us at Primotus Division of CargoTel

We have great benefits
vacation of holidays medical and dental flexible working hours work at home

items.title: QA Engineer, Mobile Healthcare Apps at Comprendo (Santa Barbara, CA) (allows remote)
items.content:
Our mobile healthcare technology platform is changing the way patients
experience healthcare for conditions like COPD, kidney failure/dialysis,
obesity, knee/hip replacement and many others.  We are looking to hire a
Quality Assurance Engineer to oversee our testing and release operations, and
to ensure our software solutions meet the highest quality standards.  

The ideal candidate is: 

* A team player that is eager to dig in and find software bugs before our
customers do
* Able to clearly communicate issues in verbal and written form for future
reference
* Self motivated and able to analyze and solve problems
* Has IMPECCABLE attention to detail and is organized (some might call you
picky)
* A go-getter who takes initiative
* Someone who stands up for quality in the face of deadlines
Skills & Requirements

Relevant work experience and skills you need to possess for this position:

* Evaluate software requirements to create test plans and procedures for all
mobile and web products
* Collaborate with customer support and engineering teams to provide timely
resolution for issues affecting consumer facing apps and online tools
* Monitor, track and report on testing activities for all products
* Drive the entry and exit criteria for testing phases, including integration
system, performance and regression testing
* Write and execute QA test plans, test cases and test automation scripts if
necessary to deliver the highest quality software
* Coordinate and execute on 
* Collaborate with project management and engineering to drive projects to
successful completion
* Manage all of the project deliverables and associated schedules to ensure
requirements are met in a desired time frame and provide feedback and problem
solving when the schedule doesn't meet deadlines
* Manage testing efforts for multiple concurrent projects with geographically
dispersed team
About Comprendo

COMPRENDO is a cutting edge healthcare tech software company. We offer a
platform for composing mobile app-based user experiences that present
patients with an educational, engaging journey to help change behaviors for
better health outcomes. Our IOS and Android solutions are used by major
hospitals and healthcare institutions and their patients on a wide variety of
health conditions.

items.title: Senior QA Automation Engineer at Conduce Inc. (Carpinteria, CA) (allows remote)
items.content:
Conduce is building a data visualization platform for real-time operational
monitoring and collaborative data discovery.  Our Systems Engineering team
provides stable, scalable and secure infrastructure to make this happen.  Using
tooling and development best practices, we define systems as code which can be
run anywhere, on anything.

We are currently looking for a Senior QA Automation Engineer to join our
QA team to help maintain and evolve our automated test efforts. 

The Senior QA Automation Engineer performs software quality assurance tasks to
ensure that developed products and services meet design specifications, are
scalable and reliable and meet total quality management criteria and standards.
Communicates with product & operations organization regarding test results and
works with engineering team as well as with cross-functional teams to interpret
feedback into product changes. Documents and reports on software performance
issues. Communicates with developers, project managers and other development
staff regarding software performance issues and testing processes. Develops
test automation scripts and executes both manual and automated testing
protocols.

Responsibilities:

* Review, maintain and evolve current automated tests and test framework.
* Develop and maintain automation test framework and test cases for
functional, performance and regression test execution.
* Lead development of automation test scripts.
* Validate and sign off on complex test plans.
* Execute automated test cases and perform manual test confirmation to
validate test results.
* Contribute to the creation of QA documentation, documents system and
framework architectures.
* Participate in the development of broad technical solutions that meet
specifications and that impact future developments.
* Assist engineering team with the isolation of difficult bugs and root cause
analysis.
* Participate in release activities with DevOps, validate and approve release
requirements to confirm successful delivery into production.
Skills & Requirements

Conduce evaluates candidates on potential, not a list of skills. That said,
we’re paying attention if you have:

* 5 + years experience in Software QA Test Engineering and Development
* Advanced knowledge of software QA engineering processes, test automation,
building and testing frameworks
* Experience in fast-paced, Agile / CI development environments
* Advanced knowledge of Java, Python, Selenium, Jenkins, Git, Robot
framework, etc. 
* Advanced knowledge of web application test development and automation,
Browserstack and Saucelab VM integration
* Knowledge of SaaS and Web 2.0 apps technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP
and JSON)
An exceptional candidate will also have experience with:

* Performance engineering and automated performance testing
* Robot framework
* Experience testing Enterprise web applications
* Jmeter and web application load generation / testing
To apply, please send the following:

A short cover letter letting us know what you think is interesting about the
work going on at Conduce and how your background fits with what we're doing.

A resume in either plain text or PDF format.

About Conduce Inc.

Conduce is a growing enterprise software company with a world-class team and a
big vision for helping people, leaders and teams unlock information and unleash
their potential. We've also got a sense of humor (despite our website
mugshots), and we're located just a short walk from the beach near Santa
Barbara, California.  

If you recognize the power of data to revolutionize the way the world works -
and you've got the skills and ambition to do something about it - we'd like to
get to know you.

Salary and stock options commensurate with experience.  Competitive benefits
package.  Working remotely (within US) possible for the right candidate.

Joel Test score: 12 out of 12

The Joel Test is
a twelve-question measure of the quality of a software team.

* Do you use source control?
* Can you make a build in one step?
* Do you make daily builds?
* Do you have a bug database?
* Do you fix bugs before writing new code?
* Do you have an up-to-date schedule?
* Do you have a spec?
* Do programmers have quiet working conditions?
* Do you use the best tools money can buy?
* Do you have testers?
* Do new candidates write code during their interview?
* Do you do hallway usability testing? apply now <> more jobs at Conduce <>
Join us at Conduce Inc.

We have great benefits
Competitive compensation, equity. Corporate focus on work-life balance.
Comprehensive health insurance package for employees and family. Paid time off
for vacation, holidays, sick and personal time. Flexible working hours. Smart,
funny colleagues solving interesting problems. Remote team; no cube farms.
Beach town; easy access to LA.

items.title: Senior QA Engineer at Conduce Inc. (Carpinteria, CA) (allows remote)
items.content:
Conduce is building a data visualization platform for real-time operational
monitoring and collaborative data discovery.  Our Systems Engineering team
provides stable, scalable and secure infrastructure to make this happen.  Using
tooling and development best practices, we define systems as code which can be
run anywhere, on anything.

We are currently looking for a Software QA Engineer to join our QA team to
assist with manual and automated web application testing. 

The Senior QA Engineer performs test planning, test development, manual and
automated test execution in support of project release goals and requirements,
as well as collaborating with other QA/Development team members to ensure
comprehensive test coverage and improve overall product quality.  

Responsibilities: 

* Define and maintain test plans and test specifications for functional,
regression, and performance testing; manual execution of test cases, manual
validation of automation failures; reporting product failures.
* Conduct review and sign-off for test plans and use cases.
* Take ownership of certain product module QA efforts.
* Work closely with engineering teams to analyze and resolve product defects.
Skills & Requirements

Conduce evaluates candidates on potential, not a list of skills. That said,
we’re paying attention if you have:

* 5 years of QA experience in reviewing product requirements and design,
creating test plans, and testing scalable, distributed, fault-tolerated
web based applications
* Experience in fast-paced, Agile / CI development environments
* White-box and black-box testing experience
* Web application UI testing experience
An exceptional candidate will also have experience with:

* SaaS and Web 2.0 apps technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP and JSON)
* Automation test tools, Python, Selenium, Robot framework
* Testing Enterprise web applications
To apply, please send the following:

A short cover letter letting us know what you think is interesting about the
work going on at Conduce and how your background fits with what we're doing.

A resume in either plain text or PDF format.

items.title: Software Quality Performance Wizard
items.content:
Do you enjoy any of the following?
- analysing & solving complex problems,
- reasoning about distributed system to find potential glitches,
- coding up complex & distributed testing scenarios,
- running performance tests & profiling code and improving its performance
- digging into existing code to find bugs & bottlenecks
- coding up & maintaining open source distributed testing framework
- delivering a technical presentation at a conference
 


At Hazelcast you will work with the best engineers out there.
- who delve into JVM code
- who implement and scrutinize garbage collection algorithms
- who take any piece of software and multiply its performance by applying deep
technical understanding.
- who regularly squash bugs in the depths of a JVM 



We are looking for people who can deliver solid code.
You may either work in our office in Istanbul / London or code remotely from a
home office.


*European timezone is preferable.

items.title: Software Quality and Performance Wizard at Hazelcast (Üsküdar, Turkey) (allows remote)
items.content:
Do you enjoy any of the following?
- analysing & solving complex problems,
- reasoning about distributed system to find potential glitches,
- coding up complex & distributed testing scenarios,
- running performance tests & profiling code and improving its performance
- digging into existing code to find bugs & bottlenecks
- coding up & maintaining open source distributed testing framework
- delivering a technical presentation at a conference
 

At Hazelcast you will work with the best engineers out there.
- who delve into JVM code
- who implement and scrutinize garbage collection algorithms
- who take any piece of software and multiply its performance by applying deep
technical understanding.
- who regularly squash bugs in the depths of a JVM 


We are looking for people who can deliver solid code.
You may either work in our office in Istanbul / London or code remotely from a
home office.

*European timezone is preferable.

Skills & Requirements

We would like you to:
- be passionate about breaking stuff and constantly think about it :)
- be a mid-senior to senior Java engineer - including all aspects connected to
it,
- be a thorough investigator who's keen on software quality assurance
- have solid networking, concurrency, serialisation, garbage-collection skills.
- be skeptical yet always open to new concepts,
- have strong opinions about software quality,
- be an excellent communicator in written and spoken English.

About Hazelcast

Change the World of Distributed Computing

At Hazelcast we deliver simplicity. We work hard to provide the world’s
simplest and most powerful open source in-memory data grid NoSQL product that
is used by thousands of developers and organizations across the world.

Are you an “A+” player? Do you like challenges? Are you passionate about
coding? If you enjoy a fast-paced environment where the only limit to your
growth is your own capabilities, send your resume tojobs@hazelcast.com
.
